verses.verse: So these three<WH7969> men<WH582> ceased<WH7673> to answer<WH6030> Job<WH347>, because he was righteous<WH6662> in his own eyes<WH5869>.

Then was kindled<WH2734> the wrath<WH639> of Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940>, of the family<WH4940> of Ram<WH7410>: against Job<WH347> was his wrath<WH639> kindled<WH2734>, because he justified<WH6663> himself<WH5315> rather than God<WH430>.
Also against his three<WH7969> friends<WH7453> was his wrath<WH639> kindled<WH2734>, because they had found<WH4672> no answer<WH4617>, and yet had condemned<WH7561> Job<WH347>.
Now Elihu<WH453> had waited<WH2442> to speak<WH1697> unto Job<WH347>, because they were elder than he<WH2205>.
And when Elihu<WH453> saw<WH7200> that there was no answer<WH4617> in the mouth<WH6310> of these three<WH7969> men<WH582>, his wrath<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>.

And Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, I am young<WH6810>, and ye are very old<WH3453>; Wherefore I held back<WH2119>, and durst<WH3372> not show<WH2331> you mine opinion<WH1843>.
I said<WH559>, Days<WH3117> should speak<WH1696>, And multitude<WH7230> of years<WH8141> should teach<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451>.
But <WH403> there is a spirit<WH7307> in man<WH582>, And the breath<WH5397> of the Almighty<WH7706> giveth them understanding<WH995>.
It is not the great<WH7227> that are wise<WH2449>, Nor the aged<WH2205> that understand<WH995> justice<WH4941>.
Therefore I said<WH559>, Hearken<WH8085> to me<WH2331>; I also will show mine opinion<WH1843>.
Behold <WH3176>, I waited for your words<WH1697>, I listened<WH238> for your reasonings<WH8394>, Whilst ye searched out<WH2713> what to say<WH4405>.
Yea <WH995>, I attended unto you<WH3198>, And, behold, there was none that convinced Job<WH347>, Or that answered<WH6030> his words<WH561>, among you.
Beware lest ye say<WH559>, We have found<WH4672> wisdom<WH2451>; God<WH410> may vanquish<WH5086> him<WH376>, not man:
For he hath not directed<WH6186> his words<WH4405> against me<WH7725>; Neither will I answer him with your speeches<WH561>.
They are amazed<WH2865>, they answer<WH6030> no more<WH6275>: They have not a word to say<WH4405>.
And shall I wait<WH3176>, because they speak<WH1696> not<WH5975>, Because they stand still, and answer no more<WH6030>?
I also will answer<WH6030> my part<WH2506>, I also will show<WH2331> mine opinion<WH1843>.
For I am full<WH4390> of words<WH4405>; The spirit<WH7307> within<WH990> me constraineth me<WH6693>.
Behold <WH990>, my breast is as wine<WH3196> which hath no vent<WH6605>; Like new<WH2319> wine-skins<WH178> it is ready to burst<WH1234>.
I will speak<WH1696>, that I may be refreshed<WH7304>; I will open<WH6605> my lips<WH8193> and answer<WH6030>.
Let me not<WH5375>, I pray you, respect any man<WH376>'s person<WH6440>; Neither will I give flattering titles<WH3655> unto any man<WH120>.
For I know<WH3045> not to give flattering titles<WH3655>; Else would my Maker<WH6213> soon<WH4592> take me away<WH5375>.
